intro: Erucastrum richeri, commonly known as the Klamath mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, branching stems. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Erucastrum richeri is an annual herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects.
